intro: Psorospermum kisantuense, commonly known as the Kisantu psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, waxy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Psorospermum kisantuense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
